* should provide ability to process inline and remote segment
* should provide ability to finalize processing (e.g. method at the end of inner loop)

issue.title: ListUploads don't show pending regular uploads
issue.body:
[Project.ListUploads](https://pkg.go.dev/storj.io/uplink#Project.ListUploads) should list all the pending uploads independently if they are regular or multipart uploads.

Currently, the method only shows multipart uploads or regular uploads that have written<sup>1</sup> enough data for not being an inline object.

Acceptance criteria:
* Find the issue of why regular uploads that have not written any data or an amount of data that doesn't create a remote object are listed.
*  Write tests to show up the issue<sup>2</sup>.
* Fix the issue for passing the tests.


---
<sup>1</sup> @Erikvv has reported this when verifying that bug with the PHP bindings.
<sup>2</sup> @ifraixedes wrote a few testsuite tests for showing that list uploads don't work for regular uploads when no data is written. https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/uplink/+/8806 The commit is in WIP because the tests don't pass. We can use these tests or write new ones for the fix commit and then rebase this commit on top of the fix commit to seeing if they pass.

comment.body: https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/uplink/+/8809

issue.title: ListUploads don't show pending regular uploads
issue.body:
[Project.ListUploads](https://pkg.go.dev/storj.io/uplink#Project.ListUploads) should list all the pending uploads independently if they are regular or multipart uploads.

Currently, the method only shows multipart uploads or regular uploads that have written<sup>1</sup> enough data for not being an inline object.

Acceptance criteria:
* Find the issue of why regular uploads that have not written any data or an amount of data that doesn't create a remote object are listed.
*  Write tests to show up the issue<sup>2</sup>.
* Fix the issue for passing the tests.


---
<sup>1</sup> @Erikvv has reported this when verifying that bug with the PHP bindings.
<sup>2</sup> @ifraixedes wrote a few testsuite tests for showing that list uploads don't work for regular uploads when no data is written. https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/uplink/+/8806 The commit is in WIP because the tests don't pass. We can use these tests or write new ones for the fix commit and then rebase this commit on top of the fix commit to seeing if they pass.

comment.body:
Assumption: the cause is that [`ObjectBeginRequest`](https://github.com/storj/common/blob/f2f1c7a50597eb6b0776b28974ae04cd3cecaaae/pb/metainfo.proto#L210) is not sent during `uplink.Project.UploadObject()` but later.

Looking at `ObjectBeginRequest` it does not have a field for inline data. So there is no reason to hold back this request until data is written. It might be a possible future optimization though.

I'm unconvinced this is a guarantee we need to give. The parts or objects should be list-able after calling `uplink.PartUpload.commit()` or `uplink.Upload.Commit()` but it's not necessary to have such guarantees while the object/part is pending.

Thinking ahead, will the next consistency issue be that when uplink.Upload.write("mydata") returns and then you close your program, the data is lost? Because uplink was waiting for either 64 MiB or commit.

I suggest we document at `uplink.Project.UploadObject()` that we have provide no guarantee that a pending object is created and close this issue.
Added a comment. This isn't in the binding yet.

issue.title: Define observer interface for sharded loop

milestone.title: Metainfo Loop Sharding: Phase 1
milestone.description:
Milestone for phase 1 of Metainfo Loop Sharding project.

More info can be found here: https://storjlabs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/2434531336/WIP+-+Metainfo+Loop+Sharding

issue.body:
We need a new observer interface for shared loop.

Acceptance Criteria:
* should work with multiple threads, implementer shouldn't be concerned with thread safety, naive implementation should be thread safe
* should provide ability to process inline and remote segment
* should provide ability to finalize processing (e.g. method at the end of inner loop)

comment.body:
> Do we have stats how much overhead there is for a particular observer?

We have some stats on this at https://chronograf.datasci.storj.io/sources/3/dashboards/82?tempVars%5Bapplication%5D=satelliteproduction-storj&tempVars%5Binstance%5D=US1&lower=now%28%29%20-%2030d#

It seems 70% of the loop is observer time and 30% loop overhead. 

> Processing should happen on batches of segments rather than one at a time. (e.g. 1024 segments (or more) at a time)

We fetch batches of 2500 from cockroach but we dispatch them to observers 1-by-1. Do you also mean to change the observer signature?

from

```
RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
```

to

```
RemoteSegment(context.Context, *[]Segment) error
```

I don't think this will make a significant difference by itself. It may open some optimization opportunities by changing underlying services to support batches. But this is somewhat out of scope of this change and also adds complexity. 

> 2. If we want true concurrency we want to have independent observers that will be combined at the end rather than aggregating all the results into the same observer.
> 
> If we use batch processing, then 2. is achievable without needing to implement "separate observers" per se, but rather you calculate the stats from those 1k segments and then merge the results into the main observer. Such observers then be safely run concurrently.

I suppose we can merge my two interfaces into one:

```
type Observer interface {
    LoopStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
    LoopEnded(context.Context, LoopEndInfo) error
    RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
    InlineSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error

    // duplicate the observer to start another batch
    Spawn(context.Context) (Observer, error) Observer
    // merge state of different batches
    Combine(context.Context, Observer) error
    // opportunity to release resources
    Close(context.Context) error
}
```

The semantics seem more complex to me. I prefer the 2-interface solution. But I acknowledge the 2 interfaces probably have duplicate or even identical state.

issue.title: Stop using objects loop for bucket accounting
issue.body:
Currently to calculate buckets stats for tally we are looping over all objects in DB. For US1 its already 330M objects. Avg object key is 140 so every 1,5h we are transferring 40-50GB of data. This can be easily avoided by using single SQL query like this:
```sql
SELECT
      project_id, bucket_name,    
      sum(total_encrypted_size) AS total_bytes,
      sum(segment_count) AS total_segments,
      sum(length(encrypted_metadata)) AS metadata_size,
      count(*) as total_objects
FROM 
    (SELECT project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version,
    total_encrypted_size, segment_count, encrypted_metadata
    FROM objects ORDER BY (project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version) ASC)
GROUP BY (project_id, bucket_name)
```
Main issue with this approach is for large satellites such query can take lots of time (us1 - 10m), but at the moment we are not sure if that a real problem. Also currently its not possible to use LIMIT statement to process in chunks because query always do full table scan. We would like to replace object loop with simple SQL query to collect all stats. As we are not fully sure how this will affect DB and system we should have a feature flag for this.

Option 2 that would give ability to split processing in chunks is:
```sql
SELECT project_id, bucket_name, SUM(total_encrypted_size), SUM(segment_count), SUM(encrypted_metadata_size), count(*) FROM  
(
    SELECT 
        project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version,
        total_encrypted_size, segment_count, length(encrypted_metadata) as encrypted_metadata_size
    FROM objects
    WHERE (project_id, bucket_name) >= ($1, $2)
    ORDER BY (project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version) ASC LIMIT $3
)
GROUP BY (project_id, bucket_name)
```
One issue with this that we would need to drop results for last bucket in chunk if there are next results page to process. We would need to do that because with limit on `objects` table we don't know if we processed all objects in a bucket. It might be still worth doing this and I think we should implement option 2.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
* we should extend buckets tally process with option to collect `accounting.BucketTally` per bucket with custom SQL query (see Option 2 above)
* SQL query should also filter out expired objects (example query from above doesn't have it)
* old implementation shouldn't be removed and should be possible use old and new implementation depends on feature flag state 
* `tally.Config` should have feature flag to be able to switch between object loop and pure SQL approach, feature flag name `UseObjectsLoop bool`

comment.body:
I ran your query through Redash on the EU backup.

```
SELECT project_id,
       bucket_name,
       SUM(total_encrypted_size),
       SUM(segment_count),
       COALESCE(SUM(length(encrypted_metadata)), 0),
       count(*)
FROM objects AS OF SYSTEM TIME '-5m'
WHERE (expires_at IS NULL
       OR expires_at > now())
GROUP BY (project_id,
          bucket_name)
ORDER BY (project_id,
          bucket_name) ASC
```

The result was 40305 rows 6 minutes runtime.

I then split into 16 batches using `project_id BETWEEN X'00000000000000000000000000000000' AND X'0fffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff'` etc.

The total run time of all batches was also around 6 minutes. Some batches were very fast like your 3 seconds some slower like a minute. This was because there are simply 100x more objects in some ranges than others.

My conclusion is that I think we don't need batching: the single query is fast enough. But it's done so I am not going to ask to change it.

milestone.description:

issue.body:
We need a new observer interface for shared loop.

Acceptance Criteria:
* should work with multiple threads, implementer shouldn't be concerned with thread safety, naive implementation should be thread safe
* should provide ability to process inline and remote segment
* should provide ability to finalize processing (e.g. method at the end of inner loop)

comment.body:
> Can you please help me to understand the problem better?

When you have a simple implementation like this:

```
class SegmentCounterObserver {
    count int = 0
    
    RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) {
        count++
    }
}
```

When this observer is called by two threads, there is a race condition and the count will be wrong.

> If I understand well, there won't be any concurrent call on the same interface.

This is true for some observers like repair. But not for others like bloom filters, audit collector, tally.

> I like the simplicity of the original Observer interface, but it's not clear what is LoopStartInfo. Is it information about the full loop, or the range loop?

This currently only contains the start time of the full loop and is only used for bloom filters. We do intend to start the ranges all at the same time. So it won't be for example 4 ranges with 2 workers, it will be the same number of ranges as workers.

issue.title: multipart-part-size.md: Clarify the correct AWS config flag
issue.body:
multipart_threshold actually refers to maximum size of a file when AWS cli switches to using multipart requests (instead of a single API call).
The correct config flag to use is multipart_chunksize

See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/topic/s3-config.html#multipart-threshold

issue.title: Error with multilple certificate resolver and pre-existing certificates. Changing the resolver, doesn't trigger the new certificate.
issue.body:
### Welcome!

- [X] Yes, I've searched similar issues on [GitHub](https://github.com/traefik/traefik/issues) and didn't find any.
- [X] Yes, I've searched similar issues on the [Traefik community forum](https://community.containo.us) and didn't find any.

### What did you do?

My system had just one certificate resolver (let's encrypt), all the domains use this certificate resolve to generate the ssl cerfiticate.
The system was already up and running with **all the certificates already generated** by let's encrypt.
I had to add a new certificate resolver (zerossl) for a specific domain. 
I've changed the container label from:
`traefik.http.routers.CONTAINER.tls.certresolver=le`
to
`traefik.http.routers.CONTAINER.tls.certresolver=zerossl`
But anything happened.

### What did you see instead?

The domain certificate was the one generated by Let's Encrypt. I've checked the logs and Traefik wasn't elaborating any new certificate for the domain with the new Zerossl resolver.

If Traefik finds a valid certificate in the first json it will use it instead of finding/generating the correct one.
 
**SOLUTION/WORKAROUND**:
- stop traefik
- edit the acme.json
- remove the specific domain lines from the json file
- restart traefik.

Now traefik is using zerossl to generate the correct SSL certificate.

### What version of Traefik are you using?

Version:      2.5.5
Codename:     brie
Go version:   go1.17.5
Built:        2021-12-10T17:00:35Z
OS/Arch:      linux/amd64

### What is your environment & configuration?

Traefik command before:
```yaml
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge=true
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge.provider=ns1
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.email=xxxx@xxxxx.ext
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.storage=/acme.json
```

Traefik command after:
```yaml
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge=true
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge.provider=ns1
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.email=xxxx@xxxxx.ext
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.storage=/acme.json
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.email=xxxx@xxxxx.ext
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.httpChallenge.entryPoint=web
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.eab.kid=*********
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.eab.hmacEncoded=*********
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.caServer=https://acme.zerossl.com/v2/DV90
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.storage=/zerossl.json
```
Container labels before:
```yaml
      - traefik.enable=true
      - traefik.http.services.XXXX.loadbalancer.server.port=123
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.rule=Host(`sub.domain.ext`)
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.tls.certresolver=le
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.entrypoints=websecure
      - traefik.docker.network=traefik-proxy
```
Container labels after:
```yaml
      - traefik.enable=true
      - traefik.http.services.XXXX.loadbalancer.server.port=123
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.rule=Host(`sub.domain.ext`)
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.tls.certresolver=zerossl
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.entrypoints=websecure
      - traefik.docker.network=traefik-proxy
```

### If applicable, please paste the log output in DEBUG level

_No response_

issue.title: Email filter does not catch emails with matching conditions
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

I created a custom filter with the condition that `if` `the sender` `contains` "TechCrunch" the action is `Move to` folder named "Newsletters." 

When I receive an email "From:
`TechCrunch 'newsletter@techcrunch.com' via 33Mail <sender@mailer1.33mail.com>`" the email lands in my Inbox.

--

I am taking `newsletter@techcrunch.com` as an example but it seems that for all emails I get via 33mail.com none of the content before `via 33Mail <sender@mailer1.33mail.com>` is filtered by the `From` condition.

--

I reproduced with an email coming from _firstname_ _surname_; `if` `the sender`  `contains`  "_firstname_ _surname_" `Move to` [name of folder]. Then when I receive an email "From:
`firstname surname <firstnamesurname@outlook.fr> `" the email lands in my Inbox.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to `https://mail.protonmail.com/filters`
2. Click `ADD FILTER`
3. Select conditions `if` `the sender` `contains`
4. Input the part of `From` that is before the email address of the sender 
5. Select `Move to`, select a folder (or create one), and click `SAVE`
6. Receive email matching the filter condition

**Expected behavior**
Emails that match the filter conditions "`if` `the sender` `contains`" should skip Inbox and land in the designated folder.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. iOS]
 - Broswer: Firefox 
 - Version: 75.0 (64-bit)
 - Plugins: Facebook Container, HTTPS everywhere, Dashlane, Privacy Badger
 - Resolution [e.g. 1440x900]
 - URL https://mail.protonmail.com/filters

~**Smartphone (please complete the following information):**~
 - Device: [e.g. iPhone6]
- OS: [e.g. iOS8.1]
- Browser [e.g. stock browser, safari]
- Version [e.g. 22]

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

issue.title: Composer repository
issue.body:
It would be nice if we had a static composer repository and publish it on linksharing. That way the developer can automatically update Uplink-PHP like usual composer dependencies.

- Maintain a packages.json manually
- Use the tool Satis (seems just moving the problem as I'll have to maintain the releases in satis.json manually)
- Write a script to generate a packages.json or satis.json.

issue.title: Define observer interface for shared loop

milestone.title: Metainfo Loop Sharding: Phase 1
milestone.description:
Milestone for phase 1 of Metainfo Loop Sharding project.

More info can be found here: https://storjlabs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/2434531336/WIP+-+Metainfo+Loop+Sharding

issue.body:
We need a new observer interface for shared loop.

Acceptance Criteria:
* should work with multiple threads, implementer shouldn't be concerned with thread safety, naive implementation should be thread safe
* should provide ability to process inline and remote segment
* should provide ability to finalize processing (e.g. method at the end of inner loop)

comment.body:
The problem with the interface in https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/5223 is that it pushes synchronization problems to the implementation. 

```
type Observer interface {
	LoopStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
	RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
	InlineSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
        LoopEnded(context.Context, LoopEndInfo) error
}
```

I was thinking something like below. The service will ask the `Observer` to create multiple `RangedObserver` instances which will process the segments. It will give also an opportunity to pass aggregated data back to the `Observer`, taking care that no such function is called concurrently.

```
type Observer interface {
    LoopStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
    CreateRangedObserver(context.Context) (RangedObserver, error)
    RangeEnded(context.Context, RangedObserver)
    LoopEnded(context.Context, LoopEndInfo) error
}

type RangedObserver interface {
    RangeStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
    RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
    InlineSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
    RangeEnded(context.Context) error
}

```

My golang-fu is not so strong so I should make a PoC implementation.

commits.message:
Add composer repository (#36)

This adds a packages.json file which can be read over HTTP from Github by
Composer. The previous installation method still works. This packages.json file
is maintained manually.

This makes Uplink-PHP behave more like a normal PHP library. This has
advantages for a PHP developer managing their project:

1. `composer update` can automatically update Uplink-PHP to the latest version

2. If we release versions which depend on different PHP versions
   or different PHP libraries, Composer will select the version most
   compatible with your project.

   Unfortunately composer currently only does a
   [limited check on platform compatibility](https://getcomposer.org/doc/01-basic-usage.md#platform-packages)
   which does not include OS type, instruction set architecture, and glibc version.

I tested this in a project with commands:

```
composer config repositories.storj/uplink '{
    "type": "composer",
    "url": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/storj-thirdparty/uplink-php/composer-repository/"
}' &&
composer require storj/uplink
```

Then it installs v1.3.0. Then I tried out all the released versions:

```
composer require storj/uplink:0.1.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.0.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.1.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.2.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.3.0
```

Solves https://github.com/storj-thirdparty/uplink-php/issues/35

commits.message:
satellite/metabase: ListObjects

Current metainfo.ListObjects implementation is using metabase iterator to list objects.
In the non-recursive case, it used to retrieve all the corresponding rows and then discarded the entries that did not fit the listing request.
This can lead in some edge cases (each prefix contains more than batchsize objects/sub-prefixes) to make unecessary calls to the db.

This change defines the metabase.ListObjects and aims at retrieving only prefixes (but not objects under it) and objects by modifying the SQL query.

In this version, it is not optimized on the database side. Cockroach will still have to go through all rows under a prefix, so there is still room for improvement.

metainfo.ListObjects is not currently using this method as we would like to assess its performance on the QA satellite first.

Fixes https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/5088

Change-Id: Ied3a9210871871d9d4a3096888d3e40c2dceed61

satellite/gc/sender: new service to send retain filters

Implement a new service to read retain filter from a bucket and
send them out to storagenodes.

This allows the retain filters to be generated by a separate command on
a backup of the database.

Paralellism (setting ConcurrentSends) and end-to-end garbage collection
tests will be restored in a subsequent commit.

Solves https://github.com/storj/team-metainfo/issues/121

sender

web/satellite: don't download the whole object for preview

Basically, I reverted this change with some modifications.
https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/storj/+/6731
We don't use signed requests anymore because its usage was not really affective and caused some UX problems like too long video loading/buffering.
We don't use presigned URLs as well because they are not really compatible (I think) with video streaming. So long videos (> 1 min long) constantly failed to buffer.
Instead of presigned URLs we just use STORJ linksharing. We generate new access grant which is valid for one day to render preview and object map.

While setting up this library on windows I am getting issue. I already have php_ffi.dll and php 7.4.26 version. Still it says its missing. Please help

    - Root composer.json requires storj/uplink ^1.3 -> satisfiable by storj/uplink[1.3.0].

comment.body:
I tested with PHP 7.4.26 on Windows and it works. 

Probably you have something wrong in your php config. 

Some ideas to help diagnose the issue:

- Check `php.exe --ini` that the correct ini files are loaded 
- Check `php.exe -r "phpinfo();"` that the modules are loaded 
- Check `php.exe -r "phpinfo();"` that warnings are enabled
  - display_errors => STDOUT
  - display_startup_errors => On
  - error_reporting => 32767

We plan to replace metabase.BeginObjectExactVersion usage in

satellite/gc/bloomfilter: uploading bloom filters

We would like to have separate process/command to collect bloom
filters from source different than production DBs. Such process will
use segment loop to build bloom filters for all storage nodes and
will send it to Storj bucket.

This change add main logic to new service. After collecting all bloom
filters with segment loop and piece tracker all filters are marshaled
and packed into zip files. Each zip contains up to "ZipBatchSize" bloom
filters and it's uploaded to specified in configuration bucket.

All uploaded objects have specified expiration time to not delete them
manually.

Updates https://github.com/storj/team-metainfo/issues/120

satellite/metainfo: fix deletion tests

Main issue with those tests was that for case where all objects were
uploaded at once (case "some nodes down" and "all nodes down").
Because all objects had the same name while upload each new object
was overwriting existing object. Because of that instead had several
objects to delete by test explicitly we had just 1. Test were not
failing because while overwriting existing object we were deleting it
but it was not what this test should do.

issue.title: ListUploads don't show pending regular uploads
issue.body:
[Project.ListUploads](https://pkg.go.dev/storj.io/uplink#Project.ListUploads) should list all the pending uploads independently if they are regular or multipart uploads.

Currently, the method only shows multipart uploads or regular uploads that have written<sup>1</sup> enough data for not being an inline object.

Acceptance criteria:
* Find the issue of why regular uploads that have not written any data or an amount of data that doesn't create a remote object are listed.
*  Write tests to show up the issue<sup>2</sup>.
* Fix the issue for passing the tests.


---
<sup>1</sup> @Erikvv has reported this when verifying that bug with the PHP bindings.
<sup>2</sup> @ifraixedes wrote a few testsuite tests for showing that list uploads don't work for regular uploads when no data is written. https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/uplink/+/8806 The commit is in WIP because the tests don't pass. We can use these tests or write new ones for the fix commit and then rebase this commit on top of the fix commit to seeing if they pass.

comment.body: https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/uplink/+/8809

issue.title: ListUploads don't show pending regular uploads
issue.body:
[Project.ListUploads](https://pkg.go.dev/storj.io/uplink#Project.ListUploads) should list all the pending uploads independently if they are regular or multipart uploads.

Currently, the method only shows multipart uploads or regular uploads that have written<sup>1</sup> enough data for not being an inline object.

Acceptance criteria:
* Find the issue of why regular uploads that have not written any data or an amount of data that doesn't create a remote object are listed.
*  Write tests to show up the issue<sup>2</sup>.
* Fix the issue for passing the tests.


---
<sup>1</sup> @Erikvv has reported this when verifying that bug with the PHP bindings.
<sup>2</sup> @ifraixedes wrote a few testsuite tests for showing that list uploads don't work for regular uploads when no data is written. https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/uplink/+/8806 The commit is in WIP because the tests don't pass. We can use these tests or write new ones for the fix commit and then rebase this commit on top of the fix commit to seeing if they pass.

comment.body:
Assumption: the cause is that [`ObjectBeginRequest`](https://github.com/storj/common/blob/f2f1c7a50597eb6b0776b28974ae04cd3cecaaae/pb/metainfo.proto#L210) is not sent during `uplink.Project.UploadObject()` but later.

Looking at `ObjectBeginRequest` it does not have a field for inline data. So there is no reason to hold back this request until data is written. It might be a possible future optimization though.

I'm unconvinced this is a guarantee we need to give. The parts or objects should be list-able after calling `uplink.PartUpload.commit()` or `uplink.Upload.Commit()` but it's not necessary to have such guarantees while the object/part is pending.

Thinking ahead, will the next consistency issue be that when uplink.Upload.write("mydata") returns and then you close your program, the data is lost? Because uplink was waiting for either 64 MiB or commit.

I suggest we document at `uplink.Project.UploadObject()` that we have provide no guarantee that a pending object is created and close this issue.
Added a comment. This isn't in the binding yet.

issue.title: Define observer interface for sharded loop

milestone.title: Metainfo Loop Sharding: Phase 1
milestone.description:
Milestone for phase 1 of Metainfo Loop Sharding project.

More info can be found here: https://storjlabs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/2434531336/WIP+-+Metainfo+Loop+Sharding

issue.body:
We need a new observer interface for shared loop.

Acceptance Criteria:
* should work with multiple threads, implementer shouldn't be concerned with thread safety, naive implementation should be thread safe
* should provide ability to process inline and remote segment
* should provide ability to finalize processing (e.g. method at the end of inner loop)

comment.body:
> Do we have stats how much overhead there is for a particular observer?

We have some stats on this at https://chronograf.datasci.storj.io/sources/3/dashboards/82?tempVars%5Bapplication%5D=satelliteproduction-storj&tempVars%5Binstance%5D=US1&lower=now%28%29%20-%2030d#

It seems 70% of the loop is observer time and 30% loop overhead. 

> Processing should happen on batches of segments rather than one at a time. (e.g. 1024 segments (or more) at a time)

We fetch batches of 2500 from cockroach but we dispatch them to observers 1-by-1. Do you also mean to change the observer signature?

from

```
RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
```

to

```
RemoteSegment(context.Context, *[]Segment) error
```

I don't think this will make a significant difference by itself. It may open some optimization opportunities by changing underlying services to support batches. But this is somewhat out of scope of this change and also adds complexity. 

> 2. If we want true concurrency we want to have independent observers that will be combined at the end rather than aggregating all the results into the same observer.
> 
> If we use batch processing, then 2. is achievable without needing to implement "separate observers" per se, but rather you calculate the stats from those 1k segments and then merge the results into the main observer. Such observers then be safely run concurrently.

I suppose we can merge my two interfaces into one:

```
type Observer interface {
    LoopStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
    LoopEnded(context.Context, LoopEndInfo) error
    RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
    InlineSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error

    // duplicate the observer to start another batch
    Spawn(context.Context) (Observer, error) Observer
    // merge state of different batches
    Combine(context.Context, Observer) error
    // opportunity to release resources
    Close(context.Context) error
}
```

The semantics seem more complex to me. I prefer the 2-interface solution. But I acknowledge the 2 interfaces probably have duplicate or even identical state.

issue.title: Stop using objects loop for bucket accounting
issue.body:
Currently to calculate buckets stats for tally we are looping over all objects in DB. For US1 its already 330M objects. Avg object key is 140 so every 1,5h we are transferring 40-50GB of data. This can be easily avoided by using single SQL query like this:
```sql
SELECT
      project_id, bucket_name,    
      sum(total_encrypted_size) AS total_bytes,
      sum(segment_count) AS total_segments,
      sum(length(encrypted_metadata)) AS metadata_size,
      count(*) as total_objects
FROM 
    (SELECT project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version,
    total_encrypted_size, segment_count, encrypted_metadata
    FROM objects ORDER BY (project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version) ASC)
GROUP BY (project_id, bucket_name)
```
Main issue with this approach is for large satellites such query can take lots of time (us1 - 10m), but at the moment we are not sure if that a real problem. Also currently its not possible to use LIMIT statement to process in chunks because query always do full table scan. We would like to replace object loop with simple SQL query to collect all stats. As we are not fully sure how this will affect DB and system we should have a feature flag for this.

Option 2 that would give ability to split processing in chunks is:
```sql
SELECT project_id, bucket_name, SUM(total_encrypted_size), SUM(segment_count), SUM(encrypted_metadata_size), count(*) FROM  
(
    SELECT 
        project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version,
        total_encrypted_size, segment_count, length(encrypted_metadata) as encrypted_metadata_size
    FROM objects
    WHERE (project_id, bucket_name) >= ($1, $2)
    ORDER BY (project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version) ASC LIMIT $3
)
GROUP BY (project_id, bucket_name)
```
One issue with this that we would need to drop results for last bucket in chunk if there are next results page to process. We would need to do that because with limit on `objects` table we don't know if we processed all objects in a bucket. It might be still worth doing this and I think we should implement option 2.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
* we should extend buckets tally process with option to collect `accounting.BucketTally` per bucket with custom SQL query (see Option 2 above)
* SQL query should also filter out expired objects (example query from above doesn't have it)
* old implementation shouldn't be removed and should be possible use old and new implementation depends on feature flag state 
* `tally.Config` should have feature flag to be able to switch between object loop and pure SQL approach, feature flag name `UseObjectsLoop bool`

comment.body:
I ran your query through Redash on the EU backup.

```
SELECT project_id,
       bucket_name,
       SUM(total_encrypted_size),
       SUM(segment_count),
       COALESCE(SUM(length(encrypted_metadata)), 0),
       count(*)
FROM objects AS OF SYSTEM TIME '-5m'
WHERE (expires_at IS NULL
       OR expires_at > now())
GROUP BY (project_id,
          bucket_name)
ORDER BY (project_id,
          bucket_name) ASC
```

The result was 40305 rows 6 minutes runtime.

I then split into 16 batches using `project_id BETWEEN X'00000000000000000000000000000000' AND X'0fffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff'` etc.

The total run time of all batches was also around 6 minutes. Some batches were very fast like your 3 seconds some slower like a minute. This was because there are simply 100x more objects in some ranges than others.

My conclusion is that I think we don't need batching: the single query is fast enough. But it's done so I am not going to ask to change it.

milestone.description:

issue.body:
We need a new observer interface for shared loop.

Acceptance Criteria:
* should work with multiple threads, implementer shouldn't be concerned with thread safety, naive implementation should be thread safe
* should provide ability to process inline and remote segment
* should provide ability to finalize processing (e.g. method at the end of inner loop)

comment.body:
> Can you please help me to understand the problem better?

When you have a simple implementation like this:

```
class SegmentCounterObserver {
    count int = 0
    
    RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) {
        count++
    }
}
```

When this observer is called by two threads, there is a race condition and the count will be wrong.

> If I understand well, there won't be any concurrent call on the same interface.

This is true for some observers like repair. But not for others like bloom filters, audit collector, tally.

> I like the simplicity of the original Observer interface, but it's not clear what is LoopStartInfo. Is it information about the full loop, or the range loop?

This currently only contains the start time of the full loop and is only used for bloom filters. We do intend to start the ranges all at the same time. So it won't be for example 4 ranges with 2 workers, it will be the same number of ranges as workers.

issue.title: Error with multilple certificate resolver and pre-existing certificates. Changing the resolver, doesn't trigger the new certificate.
issue.body:
### Welcome!

- [X] Yes, I've searched similar issues on [GitHub](https://github.com/traefik/traefik/issues) and didn't find any.
- [X] Yes, I've searched similar issues on the [Traefik community forum](https://community.containo.us) and didn't find any.

### What did you do?

My system had just one certificate resolver (let's encrypt), all the domains use this certificate resolve to generate the ssl cerfiticate.
The system was already up and running with **all the certificates already generated** by let's encrypt.
I had to add a new certificate resolver (zerossl) for a specific domain. 
I've changed the container label from:
`traefik.http.routers.CONTAINER.tls.certresolver=le`
to
`traefik.http.routers.CONTAINER.tls.certresolver=zerossl`
But anything happened.

### What did you see instead?

The domain certificate was the one generated by Let's Encrypt. I've checked the logs and Traefik wasn't elaborating any new certificate for the domain with the new Zerossl resolver.

If Traefik finds a valid certificate in the first json it will use it instead of finding/generating the correct one.
 
**SOLUTION/WORKAROUND**:
- stop traefik
- edit the acme.json
- remove the specific domain lines from the json file
- restart traefik.

Now traefik is using zerossl to generate the correct SSL certificate.

### What version of Traefik are you using?

Version:      2.5.5
Codename:     brie
Go version:   go1.17.5
Built:        2021-12-10T17:00:35Z
OS/Arch:      linux/amd64

### What is your environment & configuration?

Traefik command before:
```yaml
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge=true
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge.provider=ns1
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.email=xxxx@xxxxx.ext
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.storage=/acme.json
```

Traefik command after:
```yaml
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge=true
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge.provider=ns1
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.email=xxxx@xxxxx.ext
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.storage=/acme.json
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.email=xxxx@xxxxx.ext
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.httpChallenge.entryPoint=web
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.eab.kid=*********
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.eab.hmacEncoded=*********
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.caServer=https://acme.zerossl.com/v2/DV90
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.storage=/zerossl.json
```
Container labels before:
```yaml
      - traefik.enable=true
      - traefik.http.services.XXXX.loadbalancer.server.port=123
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.rule=Host(`sub.domain.ext`)
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.tls.certresolver=le
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.entrypoints=websecure
      - traefik.docker.network=traefik-proxy
```
Container labels after:
```yaml
      - traefik.enable=true
      - traefik.http.services.XXXX.loadbalancer.server.port=123
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.rule=Host(`sub.domain.ext`)
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.tls.certresolver=zerossl
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.entrypoints=websecure

issue.title: Email filter does not catch emails with matching conditions
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

I created a custom filter with the condition that `if` `the sender` `contains` "TechCrunch" the action is `Move to` folder named "Newsletters." 

When I receive an email "From:
`TechCrunch 'newsletter@techcrunch.com' via 33Mail <sender@mailer1.33mail.com>`" the email lands in my Inbox.

--

I am taking `newsletter@techcrunch.com` as an example but it seems that for all emails I get via 33mail.com none of the content before `via 33Mail <sender@mailer1.33mail.com>` is filtered by the `From` condition.

--

I reproduced with an email coming from _firstname_ _surname_; `if` `the sender`  `contains`  "_firstname_ _surname_" `Move to` [name of folder]. Then when I receive an email "From:
`firstname surname <firstnamesurname@outlook.fr> `" the email lands in my Inbox.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to `https://mail.protonmail.com/filters`
2. Click `ADD FILTER`
3. Select conditions `if` `the sender` `contains`
4. Input the part of `From` that is before the email address of the sender 
5. Select `Move to`, select a folder (or create one), and click `SAVE`
6. Receive email matching the filter condition

**Expected behavior**
Emails that match the filter conditions "`if` `the sender` `contains`" should skip Inbox and land in the designated folder.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. iOS]
 - Broswer: Firefox 
 - Version: 75.0 (64-bit)
 - Plugins: Facebook Container, HTTPS everywhere, Dashlane, Privacy Badger
 - Resolution [e.g. 1440x900]
 - URL https://mail.protonmail.com/filters

~**Smartphone (please complete the following information):**~
 - Device: [e.g. iPhone6]
- OS: [e.g. iOS8.1]
- Browser [e.g. stock browser, safari]
- Version [e.g. 22]

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

issue.title: Define observer interface for shared loop

milestone.title: Metainfo Loop Sharding: Phase 1
milestone.description:
Milestone for phase 1 of Metainfo Loop Sharding project.

More info can be found here: https://storjlabs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/2434531336/WIP+-+Metainfo+Loop+Sharding

issue.body:
We need a new observer interface for shared loop.

Acceptance Criteria:
* should work with multiple threads, implementer shouldn't be concerned with thread safety, naive implementation should be thread safe
* should provide ability to process inline and remote segment
* should provide ability to finalize processing (e.g. method at the end of inner loop)

comment.body:
The problem with the interface in https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/5223 is that it pushes synchronization problems to the implementation. 

```
type Observer interface {
	LoopStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
	RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
	InlineSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
        LoopEnded(context.Context, LoopEndInfo) error
}
```

I was thinking something like below. The service will ask the `Observer` to create multiple `RangedObserver` instances which will process the segments. It will give also an opportunity to pass aggregated data back to the `Observer`, taking care that no such function is called concurrently.

```
type Observer interface {
    LoopStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
    CreateRangedObserver(context.Context) (RangedObserver, error)
    RangeEnded(context.Context, RangedObserver)
    LoopEnded(context.Context, LoopEndInfo) error
}

type RangedObserver interface {
    RangeStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
    RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
    InlineSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
    RangeEnded(context.Context) error
}

```

My golang-fu is not so strong so I should make a PoC implementation.

commits.message:
Add composer repository (#36)

This adds a packages.json file which can be read over HTTP from Github by
Composer. The previous installation method still works. This packages.json file
is maintained manually.

This makes Uplink-PHP behave more like a normal PHP library. This has
advantages for a PHP developer managing their project:

1. `composer update` can automatically update Uplink-PHP to the latest version

2. If we release versions which depend on different PHP versions
   or different PHP libraries, Composer will select the version most
   compatible with your project.

   Unfortunately composer currently only does a
   [limited check on platform compatibility](https://getcomposer.org/doc/01-basic-usage.md#platform-packages)
   which does not include OS type, instruction set architecture, and glibc version.

I tested this in a project with commands:

```
composer config repositories.storj/uplink '{
    "type": "composer",
    "url": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/storj-thirdparty/uplink-php/composer-repository/"
}' &&
composer require storj/uplink
```

Then it installs v1.3.0. Then I tried out all the released versions:

```
composer require storj/uplink:0.1.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.0.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.1.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.2.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.3.0
```

Solves https://github.com/storj-thirdparty/uplink-php/issues/35

Go 1.19 added more declarations to the C header file. But it seems they
are not necessary for us and prevent libffi from reading the header.

construct a linksharing URL.

The RegisterAccess happy flow test isn't currently run in CI because there is no
auth service in storj-sim.

Solves https://github.com/storj-thirdparty/uplink-php/issues/37

commits.message:
satellite/metabase: ListObjects

Current metainfo.ListObjects implementation is using metabase iterator to list objects.
In the non-recursive case, it used to retrieve all the corresponding rows and then discarded the entries that did not fit the listing request.
This can lead in some edge cases (each prefix contains more than batchsize objects/sub-prefixes) to make unecessary calls to the db.

This change defines the metabase.ListObjects and aims at retrieving only prefixes (but not objects under it) and objects by modifying the SQL query.

In this version, it is not optimized on the database side. Cockroach will still have to go through all rows under a prefix, so there is still room for improvement.

metainfo.ListObjects is not currently using this method as we would like to assess its performance on the QA satellite first.

Fixes https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/5088

Change-Id: Ied3a9210871871d9d4a3096888d3e40c2dceed61

satellite/gc/sender: new service to send retain filters

Implement a new service to read retain filter from a bucket and
send them out to storagenodes.

This allows the retain filters to be generated by a separate command on
a backup of the database.

Paralellism (setting ConcurrentSends) and end-to-end garbage collection
tests will be restored in a subsequent commit.

Solves https://github.com/storj/team-metainfo/issues/121

Change-Id: Iaf8a33fbf6987676cc3cf74a18a8078916fe673d

satellite/gc/bloomfilter: minor cleanups

* service was running wrong RunOnce method
* after doing integration with GC sender we concluded that we don't
need special flag "gc-sender" to be uploaded as its safe to consume
partial results by GC senger. This part was removed.
* prefix format for moving data after error was unified with GC
sender

https: //github.com/storj/team-metainfo/issues/120
Change-Id: I204b696b9c2def4874ad1d17d0e84231cc98d583

web/satellite: don't download the whole object for preview

Basically, I reverted this change with some modifications.
https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/storj/+/6731
We don't use signed requests anymore because its usage was not really affective and caused some UX problems like too long video loading/buffering.
We don't use presigned URLs as well because they are not really compatible (I think) with video streaming. So long videos (> 1 min long) constantly failed to buffer.
Instead of presigned URLs we just use STORJ linksharing. We generate new access grant which is valid for one day to render preview and object map.

Issue:
https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/5025

comment.body:
I tested with PHP 7.4.26 on Windows and it works. 

Probably you have something wrong in your php config. 

Some ideas to help diagnose the issue:

- Check `php.exe --ini` that the correct ini files are loaded 
- Check `php.exe -r "phpinfo();"` that the modules are loaded 
- Check `php.exe -r "phpinfo();"` that warnings are enabled
  - display_errors => STDOUT
  - display_startup_errors => On
  - error_reporting => 32767

issue.title: ListUploads don't show pending regular uploads
issue.body:
[Project.ListUploads](https://pkg.go.dev/storj.io/uplink#Project.ListUploads) should list all the pending uploads independently if they are regular or multipart uploads.

Currently, the method only shows multipart uploads or regular uploads that have written<sup>1</sup> enough data for not being an inline object.

Acceptance criteria:
* Find the issue of why regular uploads that have not written any data or an amount of data that doesn't create a remote object are listed.
*  Write tests to show up the issue<sup>2</sup>.
* Fix the issue for passing the tests.


---
<sup>1</sup> @Erikvv has reported this when verifying that bug with the PHP bindings.
<sup>2</sup> @ifraixedes wrote a few testsuite tests for showing that list uploads don't work for regular uploads when no data is written. https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/uplink/+/8806 The commit is in WIP because the tests don't pass. We can use these tests or write new ones for the fix commit and then rebase this commit on top of the fix commit to seeing if they pass.

comment.body: https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/uplink/+/8809

issue.title: ListUploads don't show pending regular uploads
issue.body:
[Project.ListUploads](https://pkg.go.dev/storj.io/uplink#Project.ListUploads) should list all the pending uploads independently if they are regular or multipart uploads.

Currently, the method only shows multipart uploads or regular uploads that have written<sup>1</sup> enough data for not being an inline object.

Acceptance criteria:
* Find the issue of why regular uploads that have not written any data or an amount of data that doesn't create a remote object are listed.
*  Write tests to show up the issue<sup>2</sup>.
* Fix the issue for passing the tests.


---
<sup>1</sup> @Erikvv has reported this when verifying that bug with the PHP bindings.
<sup>2</sup> @ifraixedes wrote a few testsuite tests for showing that list uploads don't work for regular uploads when no data is written. https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/uplink/+/8806 The commit is in WIP because the tests don't pass. We can use these tests or write new ones for the fix commit and then rebase this commit on top of the fix commit to seeing if they pass.

comment.body:
Assumption: the cause is that [`ObjectBeginRequest`](https://github.com/storj/common/blob/f2f1c7a50597eb6b0776b28974ae04cd3cecaaae/pb/metainfo.proto#L210) is not sent during `uplink.Project.UploadObject()` but later.

Looking at `ObjectBeginRequest` it does not have a field for inline data. So there is no reason to hold back this request until data is written. It might be a possible future optimization though.

I'm unconvinced this is a guarantee we need to give. The parts or objects should be list-able after calling `uplink.PartUpload.commit()` or `uplink.Upload.Commit()` but it's not necessary to have such guarantees while the object/part is pending.

Thinking ahead, will the next consistency issue be that when uplink.Upload.write("mydata") returns and then you close your program, the data is lost? Because uplink was waiting for either 64 MiB or commit.

I suggest we document at `uplink.Project.UploadObject()` that we have provide no guarantee that a pending object is created and close this issue.
Added a comment. This isn't in the binding yet.

issue.title: Define observer interface for sharded loop

milestone.title: Metainfo Loop Sharding: Phase 1
milestone.description:
Milestone for phase 1 of Metainfo Loop Sharding project.

More info can be found here: https://storjlabs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/2434531336/WIP+-+Metainfo+Loop+Sharding

issue.body:
We need a new observer interface for shared loop.

Acceptance Criteria:
* should work with multiple threads, implementer shouldn't be concerned with thread safety, naive implementation should be thread safe
* should provide ability to process inline and remote segment
* should provide ability to finalize processing (e.g. method at the end of inner loop)

comment.body:
> Do we have stats how much overhead there is for a particular observer?

We have some stats on this at https://chronograf.datasci.storj.io/sources/3/dashboards/82?tempVars%5Bapplication%5D=satelliteproduction-storj&tempVars%5Binstance%5D=US1&lower=now%28%29%20-%2030d#

It seems 70% of the loop is observer time and 30% loop overhead. 

> Processing should happen on batches of segments rather than one at a time. (e.g. 1024 segments (or more) at a time)

We fetch batches of 2500 from cockroach but we dispatch them to observers 1-by-1. Do you also mean to change the observer signature?

from

```
RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
```

to

```
RemoteSegment(context.Context, *[]Segment) error
```

I don't think this will make a significant difference by itself. It may open some optimization opportunities by changing underlying services to support batches. But this is somewhat out of scope of this change and also adds complexity. 

> 2. If we want true concurrency we want to have independent observers that will be combined at the end rather than aggregating all the results into the same observer.
> 
> If we use batch processing, then 2. is achievable without needing to implement "separate observers" per se, but rather you calculate the stats from those 1k segments and then merge the results into the main observer. Such observers then be safely run concurrently.

I suppose we can merge my two interfaces into one:

```
type Observer interface {
    LoopStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
    LoopEnded(context.Context, LoopEndInfo) error
    RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
    InlineSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error

    // duplicate the observer to start another batch
    Spawn(context.Context) (Observer, error) Observer
    // merge state of different batches
    Combine(context.Context, Observer) error
    // opportunity to release resources
    Close(context.Context) error
}
```

The semantics seem more complex to me. I prefer the 2-interface solution. But I acknowledge the 2 interfaces probably have duplicate or even identical state.

issue.title: Stop using objects loop for bucket accounting
issue.body:
Currently to calculate buckets stats for tally we are looping over all objects in DB. For US1 its already 330M objects. Avg object key is 140 so every 1,5h we are transferring 40-50GB of data. This can be easily avoided by using single SQL query like this:
```sql
SELECT
      project_id, bucket_name,    
      sum(total_encrypted_size) AS total_bytes,
      sum(segment_count) AS total_segments,
      sum(length(encrypted_metadata)) AS metadata_size,
      count(*) as total_objects
FROM 
    (SELECT project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version,
    total_encrypted_size, segment_count, encrypted_metadata
    FROM objects ORDER BY (project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version) ASC)
GROUP BY (project_id, bucket_name)
```
Main issue with this approach is for large satellites such query can take lots of time (us1 - 10m), but at the moment we are not sure if that a real problem. Also currently its not possible to use LIMIT statement to process in chunks because query always do full table scan. We would like to replace object loop with simple SQL query to collect all stats. As we are not fully sure how this will affect DB and system we should have a feature flag for this.

Option 2 that would give ability to split processing in chunks is:
```sql
SELECT project_id, bucket_name, SUM(total_encrypted_size), SUM(segment_count), SUM(encrypted_metadata_size), count(*) FROM  
(
    SELECT 
        project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version,
        total_encrypted_size, segment_count, length(encrypted_metadata) as encrypted_metadata_size
    FROM objects
    WHERE (project_id, bucket_name) >= ($1, $2)
    ORDER BY (project_id, bucket_name, object_key, version) ASC LIMIT $3
)
GROUP BY (project_id, bucket_name)
```
One issue with this that we would need to drop results for last bucket in chunk if there are next results page to process. We would need to do that because with limit on `objects` table we don't know if we processed all objects in a bucket. It might be still worth doing this and I think we should implement option 2.

**Acceptance Criteria:**
* we should extend buckets tally process with option to collect `accounting.BucketTally` per bucket with custom SQL query (see Option 2 above)
* SQL query should also filter out expired objects (example query from above doesn't have it)
* old implementation shouldn't be removed and should be possible use old and new implementation depends on feature flag state 
* `tally.Config` should have feature flag to be able to switch between object loop and pure SQL approach, feature flag name `UseObjectsLoop bool`

comment.body:
I ran your query through Redash on the EU backup.

```
SELECT project_id,
       bucket_name,
       SUM(total_encrypted_size),
       SUM(segment_count),
       COALESCE(SUM(length(encrypted_metadata)), 0),
       count(*)
FROM objects AS OF SYSTEM TIME '-5m'
WHERE (expires_at IS NULL
       OR expires_at > now())
GROUP BY (project_id,
          bucket_name)
ORDER BY (project_id,
          bucket_name) ASC
```

The result was 40305 rows 6 minutes runtime.

I then split into 16 batches using `project_id BETWEEN X'00000000000000000000000000000000' AND X'0fffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff'` etc.

The total run time of all batches was also around 6 minutes. Some batches were very fast like your 3 seconds some slower like a minute. This was because there are simply 100x more objects in some ranges than others.

My conclusion is that I think we don't need batching: the single query is fast enough. But it's done so I am not going to ask to change it.

milestone.title: Metainfo Loop Sharding: Phase 1
milestone.description:
Milestone for phase 1 of Metainfo Loop Sharding project.

More info can be found here: https://storjlabs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/2434531336/WIP+-+Metainfo+Loop+Sharding

issue.body:
We need a new observer interface for shared loop.

Acceptance Criteria:
* should work with multiple threads, implementer shouldn't be concerned with thread safety, naive implementation should be thread safe
* should provide ability to process inline and remote segment
* should provide ability to finalize processing (e.g. method at the end of inner loop)

comment.body:
> Can you please help me to understand the problem better?

When you have a simple implementation like this:

```
class SegmentCounterObserver {
    count int = 0
    
    RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) {
        count++
    }
}
```

When this observer is called by two threads, there is a race condition and the count will be wrong.

> If I understand well, there won't be any concurrent call on the same interface.

This is true for some observers like repair. But not for others like bloom filters, audit collector, tally.

> I like the simplicity of the original Observer interface, but it's not clear what is LoopStartInfo. Is it information about the full loop, or the range loop?

This currently only contains the start time of the full loop and is only used for bloom filters. We do intend to start the ranges all at the same time. So it won't be for example 4 ranges with 2 workers, it will be the same number of ranges as workers.

issue.title: multipart-part-size.md: Clarify the correct AWS config flag
issue.body:
multipart_threshold actually refers to maximum size of a file when AWS cli switches to using multipart requests (instead of a single API call).
The correct config flag to use is multipart_chunksize

See https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/topic/s3-config.html#multipart-threshold

issue.title: Error with multilple certificate resolver and pre-existing certificates. Changing the resolver, doesn't trigger the new certificate.
issue.body:
### Welcome!

- [X] Yes, I've searched similar issues on [GitHub](https://github.com/traefik/traefik/issues) and didn't find any.
- [X] Yes, I've searched similar issues on the [Traefik community forum](https://community.containo.us) and didn't find any.

### What did you do?

My system had just one certificate resolver (let's encrypt), all the domains use this certificate resolve to generate the ssl cerfiticate.
The system was already up and running with **all the certificates already generated** by let's encrypt.
I had to add a new certificate resolver (zerossl) for a specific domain. 
I've changed the container label from:
`traefik.http.routers.CONTAINER.tls.certresolver=le`
to
`traefik.http.routers.CONTAINER.tls.certresolver=zerossl`
But anything happened.

### What did you see instead?

The domain certificate was the one generated by Let's Encrypt. I've checked the logs and Traefik wasn't elaborating any new certificate for the domain with the new Zerossl resolver.

If Traefik finds a valid certificate in the first json it will use it instead of finding/generating the correct one.
 
**SOLUTION/WORKAROUND**:
- stop traefik
- edit the acme.json
- remove the specific domain lines from the json file
- restart traefik.

Now traefik is using zerossl to generate the correct SSL certificate.

### What version of Traefik are you using?

Version:      2.5.5
Codename:     brie
Go version:   go1.17.5
Built:        2021-12-10T17:00:35Z
OS/Arch:      linux/amd64

### What is your environment & configuration?

Traefik command before:
```yaml
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge=true
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge.provider=ns1
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.email=xxxx@xxxxx.ext
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.storage=/acme.json
```

Traefik command after:
```yaml
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge=true
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.dnschallenge.provider=ns1
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.email=xxxx@xxxxx.ext
      - --certificatesresolvers.le.acme.storage=/acme.json
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.email=xxxx@xxxxx.ext
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.httpChallenge.entryPoint=web
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.eab.kid=*********
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.eab.hmacEncoded=*********
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.caServer=https://acme.zerossl.com/v2/DV90
      - --certificatesresolvers.zerossl.acme.storage=/zerossl.json
```
Container labels before:
```yaml
      - traefik.enable=true
      - traefik.http.services.XXXX.loadbalancer.server.port=123
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.rule=Host(`sub.domain.ext`)
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.tls.certresolver=le
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.entrypoints=websecure
      - traefik.docker.network=traefik-proxy
```
Container labels after:
```yaml
      - traefik.enable=true
      - traefik.http.services.XXXX.loadbalancer.server.port=123
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.rule=Host(`sub.domain.ext`)
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.tls.certresolver=zerossl
      - traefik.http.routers.XXXX.entrypoints=websecure
      - traefik.docker.network=traefik-proxy
```

### If applicable, please paste the log output in DEBUG level

_No response_

issue.title: Email filter does not catch emails with matching conditions
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

I created a custom filter with the condition that `if` `the sender` `contains` "TechCrunch" the action is `Move to` folder named "Newsletters." 

When I receive an email "From:
`TechCrunch 'newsletter@techcrunch.com' via 33Mail <sender@mailer1.33mail.com>`" the email lands in my Inbox.

--

I am taking `newsletter@techcrunch.com` as an example but it seems that for all emails I get via 33mail.com none of the content before `via 33Mail <sender@mailer1.33mail.com>` is filtered by the `From` condition.

--

I reproduced with an email coming from _firstname_ _surname_; `if` `the sender`  `contains`  "_firstname_ _surname_" `Move to` [name of folder]. Then when I receive an email "From:
`firstname surname <firstnamesurname@outlook.fr> `" the email lands in my Inbox.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to `https://mail.protonmail.com/filters`
2. Click `ADD FILTER`
3. Select conditions `if` `the sender` `contains`
4. Input the part of `From` that is before the email address of the sender 
5. Select `Move to`, select a folder (or create one), and click `SAVE`
6. Receive email matching the filter condition

**Expected behavior**
Emails that match the filter conditions "`if` `the sender` `contains`" should skip Inbox and land in the designated folder.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. iOS]
 - Broswer: Firefox 
 - Version: 75.0 (64-bit)
 - Plugins: Facebook Container, HTTPS everywhere, Dashlane, Privacy Badger
 - Resolution [e.g. 1440x900]
 - URL https://mail.protonmail.com/filters

~**Smartphone (please complete the following information):**~
 - Device: [e.g. iPhone6]
- OS: [e.g. iOS8.1]
- Browser [e.g. stock browser, safari]
- Version [e.g. 22]

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

issue.title: Define observer interface for shared loop

milestone.title: Metainfo Loop Sharding: Phase 1
milestone.description:
Milestone for phase 1 of Metainfo Loop Sharding project.

More info can be found here: https://storjlabs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/ENG/pages/2434531336/WIP+-+Metainfo+Loop+Sharding

issue.body:
We need a new observer interface for shared loop.

Acceptance Criteria:
* should work with multiple threads, implementer shouldn't be concerned with thread safety, naive implementation should be thread safe
* should provide ability to process inline and remote segment
* should provide ability to finalize processing (e.g. method at the end of inner loop)

comment.body:
The problem with the interface in https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/5223 is that it pushes synchronization problems to the implementation. 

```
type Observer interface {
	LoopStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
	RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
	InlineSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
        LoopEnded(context.Context, LoopEndInfo) error
}
```

I was thinking something like below. The service will ask the `Observer` to create multiple `RangedObserver` instances which will process the segments. It will give also an opportunity to pass aggregated data back to the `Observer`, taking care that no such function is called concurrently.

```
type Observer interface {
    LoopStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
    CreateRangedObserver(context.Context) (RangedObserver, error)
    RangeEnded(context.Context, RangedObserver)
    LoopEnded(context.Context, LoopEndInfo) error
}

type RangedObserver interface {
    RangeStarted(context.Context, LoopStartInfo) error
    RemoteSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
    InlineSegment(context.Context, *Segment) error
    RangeEnded(context.Context) error
}

```

My golang-fu is not so strong so I should make a PoC implementation.

commits.message:
Add composer repository (#36)

This adds a packages.json file which can be read over HTTP from Github by
Composer. The previous installation method still works. This packages.json file
is maintained manually.

This makes Uplink-PHP behave more like a normal PHP library. This has
advantages for a PHP developer managing their project:

1. `composer update` can automatically update Uplink-PHP to the latest version

2. If we release versions which depend on different PHP versions
   or different PHP libraries, Composer will select the version most
   compatible with your project.

   Unfortunately composer currently only does a
   [limited check on platform compatibility](https://getcomposer.org/doc/01-basic-usage.md#platform-packages)
   which does not include OS type, instruction set architecture, and glibc version.

I tested this in a project with commands:

```
composer config repositories.storj/uplink '{
    "type": "composer",
    "url": "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/storj-thirdparty/uplink-php/composer-repository/"
}' &&
composer require storj/uplink
```

Then it installs v1.3.0. Then I tried out all the released versions:

```
composer require storj/uplink:0.1.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.0.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.1.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.2.0
composer require storj/uplink:1.3.0
```

Solves https://github.com/storj-thirdparty/uplink-php/issues/35

Makefile: go 1.19 compatibility (#38)

Go 1.19 added more declarations to the C header file. But it seems they
are not necessary for us and prevent libffi from reading the header.

Add new bindings to register access for the S3-compatible gateway and to
construct a linksharing URL.

The RegisterAccess happy flow test isn't currently run in CI because there is no
auth service in storj-sim.

Solves https://github.com/storj-thirdparty/uplink-php/issues/37

commits.message:
satellite/metabase: ListObjects

Current metainfo.ListObjects implementation is using metabase iterator to list objects.
In the non-recursive case, it used to retrieve all the corresponding rows and then discarded the entries that did not fit the listing request.
This can lead in some edge cases (each prefix contains more than batchsize objects/sub-prefixes) to make unecessary calls to the db.

This change defines the metabase.ListObjects and aims at retrieving only prefixes (but not objects under it) and objects by modifying the SQL query.

In this version, it is not optimized on the database side. Cockroach will still have to go through all rows under a prefix, so there is still room for improvement.

metainfo.ListObjects is not currently using this method as we would like to assess its performance on the QA satellite first.

Fixes https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/5088

Change-Id: Ied3a9210871871d9d4a3096888d3e40c2dceed61

satellite/gc/sender: new service to send retain filters

Implement a new service to read retain filter from a bucket and
send them out to storagenodes.

This allows the retain filters to be generated by a separate command on
a backup of the database.

Paralellism (setting ConcurrentSends) and end-to-end garbage collection
tests will be restored in a subsequent commit.

Solves https://github.com/storj/team-metainfo/issues/121

Change-Id: Iaf8a33fbf6987676cc3cf74a18a8078916fe673d

satellite/gc/bloomfilter: minor cleanups

* service was running wrong RunOnce method
* after doing integration with GC sender we concluded that we don't
need special flag "gc-sender" to be uploaded as its safe to consume
partial results by GC senger. This part was removed.
* prefix format for moving data after error was unified with GC
sender

https: //github.com/storj/team-metainfo/issues/120
Change-Id: I204b696b9c2def4874ad1d17d0e84231cc98d583

web/satellite: don't download the whole object for preview

Basically, I reverted this change with some modifications.
https://review.dev.storj.io/c/storj/storj/+/6731
We don't use signed requests anymore because its usage was not really affective and caused some UX problems like too long video loading/buffering.
We don't use presigned URLs as well because they are not really compatible (I think) with video streaming. So long videos (> 1 min long) constantly failed to buffer.
Instead of presigned URLs we just use STORJ linksharing. We generate new access grant which is valid for one day to render preview and object map.

Issue:
https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/5025

Change-Id: I0313f2c6b78811f1058c25fdf5b94dc5d563c15d

web/{storagenode,multinode}: Upgrade to Vue 2.7

2.7 natively supports the Composition API, which makes transitioning to
Vue 3 easier to do step-by-step.

see: https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/5145

Change-Id: I34e13b4e4c07176f73a89ef00e3dcd6767694554

satellite/metabase: test list pending versioned objects

Assert that listing pending objects works with our new object consistency
approach.

Half of https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/4868

satellite/{metainfo,metabase}: prepare feature flag MultipleVersions

We will introduce new logic for creating new objects (BeginObject).
Instead of using single version internally (1) we will be selecting first
available version during object creation. Because we need to be sure
that everything is wired up correctly we need a feature flag to be
able to control if new feature is enabled.

comment.body:
Maybe you can explain better what this tool can help me with so maybe I don't have to go for a full mute but constomize it otherwise.

I am on the blocklist but I remember I mainly asked it to stop these 5 PM pings which I don't want because I'm acutely aware of all the open changes anyways. 

I had hoped to rely on notifications for github and e-mail filters for gerrit. But the github notifications are just too much because I get everything from all teams, and protonmail's e-mail filters are too limited. So I am just overwhelmed and it has all become pretty useless...

issue.title: Issue while setting up composer on windows
issue.body:
While setting up this library on windows I am getting issue. I already have php_ffi.dll and php 7.4.26 version. Still it says its missing. Please help

    - Root composer.json requires storj/uplink ^1.3 -> satisfiable by storj/uplink[1.3.0].
    - storj/uplink 1.3.0 requires ext-ffi * -> it is missing from your system. Install or enable PHP's ffi extension.

comment.body:
I tested with PHP 7.4.26 on Windows and it works. 

Probably you have something wrong in your php config. 

Some ideas to help diagnose the issue:

- Check `php.exe --ini` that the correct ini files are loaded 
- Check `php.exe -r "phpinfo();"` that the modules are loaded 
- Check `php.exe -r "phpinfo();"` that warnings are enabled
  - display_errors => STDOUT
  - display_startup_errors => On
  - error_reporting => 32767

satellite/metabase: BeginObjectNextVersion returns object

We plan to replace metabase.BeginObjectExactVersion usage in
metainfo.BeginObject with metabase.BeginObjectNextVersion. To make this
switch as simple a possible would be nice to have the same results for
both methods. This change is extending return value for
BeginObjectNextVersion to whole object struct. Tests were also adjusted
to be more like metabase.BeginObjectExactVersion tests.

Part of https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/4871

Change-Id: I4db99d74af07e5a73757b55233e0bbdc7b99d565

satellite/gc/bloomfilter: uploading bloom filters

We would like to have separate process/command to collect bloom
filters from source different than production DBs. Such process will
use segment loop to build bloom filters for all storage nodes and
will send it to Storj bucket.

This change add main logic to new service. After collecting all bloom
filters with segment loop and piece tracker all filters are marshaled
and packed into zip files. Each zip contains up to "ZipBatchSize" bloom
filters and it's uploaded to specified in configuration bucket.

All uploaded objects have specified expiration time to not delete them
manually.

Updates https://github.com/storj/team-metainfo/issues/120

Change-Id: I2b6bc02a7dd7c3a639e75810fd013ae4afdc80a2

satellite/metainfo: fix deletion tests

Main issue with those tests was that for case where all objects were
uploaded at once (case "some nodes down" and "all nodes down").
Because all objects had the same name while upload each new object
was overwriting existing object. Because of that instead had several
objects to delete by test explicitly we had just 1. Test were not
failing because while overwriting existing object we were deleting it
but it was not what this test should do.

Change-Id: I602116f00be66589c7c0e68fe28c25e5c03e6b5d

satellite/metabase: add ListVerifySegments

We need a method for getting a list of segments from the metabase,
without converting the aliases and omitting all inline segments.

Change-Id: I26d919c675fc285ab03a35b327edd9b5c8bbe4b0

cmd/tools/segment-verify: implement batch creation

Implements creating roughly load-balanced set of batched
that can be used to make multiple requests.

Change-Id: I349b276176dcb8ba9163e7e06a94509d73fa5ddc

cmd/tools/segment-verify: add processing of a collection of segments

This adds logic to put segments into batches and retry them.

Change-Id: I86450e2f5ab13edb3ae9a5d5b9417e0cced2892b

web/satellite: fix add card container's close icon

Fixed X-icon positioning for add card container on new billing screen.

Issue:
https://github.com/storj/storj/issues/5120

Change-Id: I9c2a62a8ff9a268671d798d1568b07d54c6282a6

satellite/oidc: include nodeURL in oidc configuration

By including NodeURL in the OIDC well-known configuration, we're
able to discover the NodeURL for a given HTTP address without
any client side assumptions or needing to make a drpc to discover
this. Instead, it's included in a call that is already made by an
OIDC/OAuth enabled client.
